intro: Ormocarpum setosum, commonly known as the hairy ormulu, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Ormocarpum setosum is often found growing in rocky or dry soils, thriving in sunny environments. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, making it recognizable in its natural habitat.
